meanings.definition: To cause to appear small or insignificant in comparison.
meanings.sent1: The tall tree next to the house was dwarfing the small bush.
meanings.sent2: The giant skyscraper was dwarfing the surrounding buildings.
meanings.sent3: The tiny toy car was dwarfing the massive toy truck.
meanings.sent4: The bright sun dwarfing the dim stars in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The huge mountain dwarfing the tiny village below.
meanings.sent6: In the garden, the large sunflower was dwarfing the delicate daisies.
meanings.sent7: The massive ship was dwarfing the small boats in the harbor.

meanings.definition: To make smaller or stunted in growth.
meanings.sent1: The lack of sunlight was dwarfing the plant's growth.
meanings.sent2: The harsh winter weather was dwarfing the trees in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The constant pruning was dwarfing the bushes in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The limited nutrients were dwarfing the flowers in the field.
meanings.sent5: The dry soil was dwarfing the crops in the farm.
meanings.sent6: The heavy snow was dwarfing the grass in the meadow.
meanings.sent7: The strong winds were dwarfing the plants in the backyard.

meanings.definition: To overshadow or make seem less important.
meanings.sent1: The main actor's performance was dwarfing the supporting cast.
meanings.sent2: The grand finale was dwarfing the rest of the show.
meanings.sent3: The impressive fireworks display was dwarfing the other attractions.
meanings.sent4: The stunning artwork was dwarfing the other pieces in the gallery.
meanings.sent5: The powerful speech was dwarfing the previous presentations.
meanings.sent6: The loud music was dwarfing the background noise.
meanings.sent7: The bright spotlight was dwarfing the dim stage lighting.
